author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Chapter 2
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The thirtieth day of May, 1887, fell on a Monday. It was one of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the war, escorted by military and civic processions and bands of music,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were wont on this occasion to visit the cemeteries and lay wreaths of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

author: Bellamy, Edward

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887

text: nothing which seemed impracticable even to the timid. To be sure it was
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a step beyond any yet taken, a broader generalization, but the very
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fact that the nation would be the sole corporation in the field would,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it was seen, relieve the undertaking of many difficulties with which
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the partial monopolies had contended."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Chapter 6
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Dr. Leete ceased speaking, and I remained silent, endeavoring to form
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: some general conception of the changes in the arrangements of society
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: implied in the tremendous revolution which he had described.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Finally I said, "The idea of such an extension of the functions of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: government is, to say the least, rather overwhelming."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Extension!" he repeated, "where is the extension?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In my day," I replied, "it was considered that the proper functions of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: government, strictly speaking, were limited to keeping the peace and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: defending the people against the public enemy, that is, to the military
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and police powers."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And, in heaven's name, who are the public enemies?" exclaimed Dr.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Leete. "Are they France, England, Germany, or hunger, cold, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nakedness? In your day governments were accustomed, on the slightest
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: international misunderstanding, to seize upon the bodies of citizens
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and deliver them over by hundreds of thousands to death and mutilation,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wasting their treasures the while like water; and all this oftenest for
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no imaginable profit to the victims. We have no wars now, and our
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: governments no war powers, but in order to protect every citizen
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: against hunger, cold, and nakedness, and provide for all his physical
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and mental needs, the function is assumed of directing his industry for
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a term of years. No, Mr. West, I am sure on reflection you will
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: perceive that it was in your age, not in ours, that the extension of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the functions of governments was extraordinary. Not even for the best
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ends would men now allow their governments such powers as were then
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: used for the most maleficent."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Leaving comparisons aside," I said, "the demagoguery and corruption of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our public men would have been considered, in my day, insuperable
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: objections to any assumption by government of the charge of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: national industries. We should have thought that no arrangement could
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be worse than to entrust the politicians with control of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wealth-producing machinery of the country. Its material interests were
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: quite too much the football of parties as it was."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "No doubt you were right," rejoined Dr. Leete, "but all that is changed
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: now. We have no parties or politicians, and as for demagoguery and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: corruption, they are words having only an historical significance."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Human nature itself must have changed very much," I said.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Not at all," was Dr. Leete's reply, "but the conditions of human life
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have changed, and with them the motives of human action. The
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organization of society with you was such that officials were under a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: constant temptation to misuse their power for the private profit of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves or others. Under such circumstances it seems almost strange
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that you dared entrust them with any of your affairs. Nowadays, on the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: contrary, society is so constituted that there is absolutely no way in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which an official, however ill-disposed, could possibly make any profit
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for himself or any one else by a misuse of his power. Let him be as bad
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: an official as you please, he cannot be a corrupt one. There is no
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: motive to be. The social system no longer offers a premium on
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dishonesty. But these are matters which you can only understand as you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: come, with time, to know us better."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But you have not yet told me how you have settled the labor problem.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: It is the problem of capital which we have been discussing," I said.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "After the nation had assumed conduct of the mills, machinery,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: railroads, farms, mines, and capital in general of the country, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor question still remained. In assuming the responsibilities of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capital the nation had assumed the difficulties of the capitalist's
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: position."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The moment the nation assumed the responsibilities of capital those
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: difficulties vanished," replied Dr. Leete. "The national organization
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of labor under one direction was the complete solution of what was, in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: your day and under your system, justly regarded as the insoluble labor
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: problem. When the nation became the sole employer, all the citizens, by
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: virtue of their citizenship, became employees, to be distributed
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: according to the needs of industry."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That is," I suggested, "you have simply applied the principle of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: universal military service, as it was understood in our day, to the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor question."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Yes," said Dr. Leete, "that was something which followed as a matter
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of course as soon as the nation had become the sole capitalist. The
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: people were already accustomed to the idea that the obligation of every
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: citizen, not physically disabled, to contribute his military services
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the defense of the nation was equal and absolute. That it was
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equally the duty of every citizen to contribute his quota of industrial
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or intellectual services to the maintenance of the nation was equally
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: evident, though it was not until the nation became the employer of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor that citizens were able to render this sort of service with any
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pretense either of universality or equity. No organization of labor was
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible when the employing power was divided among hundreds or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thousands of individuals and corporations, between which concert of any
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: kind was neither desired, nor indeed feasible. It constantly happened
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: then that vast numbers who desired to labor could find no opportunity,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and on the other hand, those who desired to evade a part or all of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their debt could easily do so."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Service, now, I suppose, is compulsory upon all," I suggested.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is rather a matter of course than of compulsion," replied Dr.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Leete. "It is regarded as so absolutely natural and reasonable that the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: idea of its being compulsory has ceased to be thought of. He would be
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thought to be an incredibly contemptible person who should need
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: compulsion in such a case. Nevertheless, to speak of service being
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: compulsory would be a weak way to state its absolute inevitableness.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Our entire social order is so wholly based upon and deduced from it
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that if it were conceivable that a man could escape it, he would be
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: left with no possible way to provide for his existence. He would have
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: excluded himself from the world, cut himself off from his kind, in a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: word, committed suicide."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Is the term of service in this industrial army for life?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Oh, no; it both begins later and ends earlier than the average working
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: period in your day. Your workshops were filled with children and old
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: men, but we hold the period of youth sacred to education, and the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: period of maturity, when the physical forces begin to flag, equally
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sacred to ease and agreeable relaxation. The period of industrial
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: service is twenty-four years, beginning at the close of the course of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: education at twenty-one and terminating at forty-five. After
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forty-five, while discharged from labor, the citizen still remains
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: liable to special calls, in case of emergencies causing a sudden great
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: increase in the demand for labor, till he reaches the age of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fifty-five, but such calls are rarely, in fact almost never, made. The
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fifteenth day of October of every year is what we call Muster Day,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: because those who have reached the age of twenty-one are then mustered
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: into the industrial service, and at the same time those who, after
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: twenty-four years' service, have reached the age of forty-five, are
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: honorably mustered out. It is the great day of the year with us, whence
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: we reckon all other events, our Olympiad, save that it is annual."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Chapter 7
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is after you have mustered your industrial army into service," I
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: said, "that I should expect the chief difficulty to arise, for there
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: its analogy with a military army must cease. Soldiers have all the same
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: thing, and a very simple thing, to do, namely, to practice the manual
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of arms, to march and stand guard. But the industrial army must learn
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and follow two or three hundred diverse trades and avocations. What
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: administrative talent can be equal to determining wisely what trade or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business every individual in a great nation shall pursue?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The administration has nothing to do with determining that point."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Who does determine it, then?" I asked.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Every man for himself in accordance with his natural aptitude, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: utmost pains being taken to enable him to find out what his natural
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: aptitude really is. The principle on which our industrial army is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organized is that a man's natural endowments, mental and physical,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: determine what he can work at most profitably to the nation and most
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: satisfactorily to himself. While the obligation of service in some form
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is not to be evaded, voluntary election, subject only to necessary
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: regulation, is depended on to determine the particular sort of service
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: every man is to render. As an individual's satisfaction during his term
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of service depends on his having an occupation to his taste, parents
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and teachers watch from early years for indications of special
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: aptitudes in children. A thorough study of the National industrial
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system, with the history and rudiments of all the great trades, is an
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: essential part of our educational system. While manual training is not
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: allowed to encroach on the general intellectual culture to which our
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: schools are devoted, it is carried far enough to give our youth, in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: addition to their theoretical knowledge of the national industries,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mechanical and agricultural, a certain familiarity with their tools and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: methods. Our schools are constantly visiting our workshops, and often
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are taken on long excursions to inspect particular industrial
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enterprises. In your day a man was not ashamed to be grossly ignorant
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of all trades except his own, but such ignorance would not be
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consistent with our idea of placing every one in a position to select
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: intelligently the occupation for which he has most taste. Usually long
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before he is mustered into service a young man has found out the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pursuit he wants to follow, has acquired a great deal of knowledge
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about it, and is waiting impatiently the time when he can enlist in its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ranks."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Surely," I said, "it can hardly be that the number of volunteers for
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: any trade is exactly the number needed in that trade. It must be
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: generally either under or over the demand."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The supply of volunteers is always expected to fully equal the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: demand," replied Dr. Leete. "It is the business of the administration
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to see that this is the case. The rate of volunteering for each trade
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is closely watched. If there be a noticeably greater excess of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: volunteers over men needed in any trade, it is inferred that the trade
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: offers greater attractions than others. On the other hand, if the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: number of volunteers for a trade tends to drop below the demand, it is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inferred that it is thought more arduous. It is the business of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: administration to seek constantly to equalize the attractions of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trades, so far as the conditions of labor in them are concerned, so
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that all trades shall be equally attractive to persons having natural
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tastes for them. This is done by making the hours of labor in different
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trades to differ according to their arduousness. The lighter trades,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prosecuted under the most agreeable circumstances, have in this way the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: longest hours, while an arduous trade, such as mining, has very short
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hours. There is no theory, no a priori rule, by which the respective
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: attractiveness of industries is determined. The administration, in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: taking burdens off one class of workers and adding them to other
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: classes, simply follows the fluctuations of opinion among the workers
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: themselves as indicated by the rate of volunteering. The principle is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that no man's work ought to be, on the whole, harder for him than any
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: other man's for him, the workers themselves to be the judges. There are
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no limits to the application of this rule. If any particular occupation
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is in itself so arduous or so oppressive that, in order to induce
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: volunteers, the day's work in it had to be reduced to ten minutes, it
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would be done. If, even then, no man was willing to do it, it would
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remain undone. But of course, in point of fact, a moderate reduction in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the hours of labor, or addition of other privileges, suffices to secure
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all needed volunteers for any occupation necessary to men. If, indeed,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the unavoidable difficulties and dangers of such a necessary pursuit
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were so great that no inducement of compensating advantages would
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: overcome men's repugnance to it, the administration would only need to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: take it out of the common order of occupations by declaring it 'extra
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hazardous,' and those who pursued it especially worthy of the national
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: gratitude, to be overrun with volunteers. Our young men are very greedy
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of honor, and do not let slip such opportunities. Of course you will
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: see that dependence on the purely voluntary choice of avocations
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: involves the abolition in all of anything like unhygienic conditions or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: special peril to life and limb. Health and safety are conditions common
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to all industries. The nation does not maim and slaughter its workmen
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by thousands, as did the private capitalists and corporations of your
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: day."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "When there are more who want to enter a particular trade than there is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: room for, how do you decide between the applicants?" I inquired.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Preference is given to those who have acquired the most knowledge of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the trade they wish to follow. No man, however, who through successive
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: years remains persistent in his desire to show what he can do at any
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: particular trade, is in the end denied an opportunity. Meanwhile, if a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: man cannot at first win entrance into the business he prefers, he has
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: usually one or more alternative preferences, pursuits for which he has
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: some degree of aptitude, although not the highest. Every one, indeed,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is expected to study his aptitudes so as to have not only a first
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: choice as to occupation, but a second or third, so that if, either at
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the outset of his career or subsequently, owing to the progress of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: invention or changes in demand, he is unable to follow his first
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vocation, he can still find reasonably congenial employment. This
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: principle of secondary choices as to occupation is quite important in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our system. I should add, in reference to the counter-possibility of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: some sudden failure of volunteers in a particular trade, or some sudden
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: necessity of an increased force, that the administration, while
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: depending on the voluntary system for filling up the trades as a rule,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: holds always in reserve the power to call for special volunteers, or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: draft any force needed from any quarter. Generally, however, all needs
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of this sort can be met by details from the class of unskilled or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: common laborers."

text: third grades, according to ability, and these grades are in many cases
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: subdivided into first and second classes. According to his standing as
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: an apprentice a young man is assigned his place as a first, second, or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: third grade worker. Of course only men of unusual ability pass directly
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from apprenticeship into the first grade of the workers. The most fall
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: into the lower grades, working up as they grow more experienced, at the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: periodical regradings. These regradings take place in each industry at
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: intervals corresponding with the length of the apprenticeship to that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industry, so that merit never need wait long to rise, nor can any rest
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on past achievements unless they would drop into a lower rank. One of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the notable advantages of a high grading is the privilege it gives the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: worker in electing which of the various branches or processes of his
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industry he will follow as his specialty. Of course it is not intended
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that any of these processes shall be disproportionately arduous, but
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there is often much difference between them, and the privilege of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: election is accordingly highly prized. So far as possible, indeed, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: preferences even of the poorest workmen are considered in assigning
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them their line of work, because not only their happiness but their
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: usefulness is thus enhanced. While, however, the wish of the lower
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grade man is consulted so far as the exigencies of the service permit,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: he is considered only after the upper grade men have been provided for,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and often he has to put up with second or third choice, or even with an
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: arbitrary assignment when help is needed. This privilege of election
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: attends every regrading, and when a man loses his grade he also risks
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: having to exchange the sort of work he likes for some other less to his
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: taste. The results of each regrading, giving the standing of every man
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in his industry, are gazetted in the public prints, and those who have
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: won promotion since the last regrading receive the nation's thanks and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are publicly invested with the badge of their new rank."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What may this badge be?" I asked.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Every industry has its emblematic device," replied Dr. Leete, "and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this, in the shape of a metallic badge so small that you might not see
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it unless you knew where to look, is all the insignia which the men of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the army wear, except where public convenience demands a distinctive
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: uniform. This badge is the same in form for all grades of industry, but
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: while the badge of the third grade is iron, that of the second grade is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: silver, and that of the first is gilt.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Apart from the grand incentive to endeavor afforded by the fact that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the high places in the nation are open only to the highest class men,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and that rank in the army constitutes the only mode of social
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distinction for the vast majority who are not aspirants in art,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: literature, and the professions, various incitements of a minor, but
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: perhaps equally effective, sort are provided in the form of special
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: privileges and immunities in the way of discipline, which the superior
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: class men enjoy. These, while intended to be as little as possible
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: invidious to the less successful, have the effect of keeping constantly
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: before every man's mind the great desirability of attaining the grade
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: next above his own.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is obviously important that not only the good but also the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: indifferent and poor workmen should be able to cherish the ambition of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rising. Indeed, the number of the latter being so much greater, it is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: even more essential that the ranking system should not operate to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: discourage them than that it should stimulate the others. It is to this
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: end that the grades are divided into classes. The grades as well as the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: classes being made numerically equal at each regrading, there is not at
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: any time, counting out the officers and the unclassified and apprentice
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grades, over one-ninth of the industrial army in the lowest class, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: most of this number are recent apprentices, all of whom expect to rise.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Those who remain during the entire term of service in the lowest class
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are but a trifling fraction of the industrial army, and likely to be as
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: deficient in sensibility to their position as in ability to better it.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It is not even necessary that a worker should win promotion to a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: higher grade to have at least a taste of glory. While promotion
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: requires a general excellence of record as a worker, honorable mention
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and various sorts of prizes are awarded for excellence less than
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sufficient for promotion, and also for special feats and single
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: performances in the various industries. There are many minor
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distinctions of standing, not only within the grades but within the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: classes, each of which acts as a spur to the efforts of a group. It is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: intended that no form of merit shall wholly fail of recognition.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As for actual neglect of work positively bad work, or other overt
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remissness on the part of men incapable of generous motives, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: discipline of the industrial army is far too strict to allow anything
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whatever of the sort. A man able to do duty, and persistently refusing,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is sentenced to solitary imprisonment on bread and water till he
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consents.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The lowest grade of the officers of the industrial army, that of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: assistant foremen or lieutenants, is appointed out of men who have held
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their place for two years in the first class of the first grade. Where
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: this leaves too large a range of choice, only the first group of this
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: class are eligible. No one thus comes to the point of commanding men
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: until he is about thirty years old. After a man becomes an officer, his
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rating of course no longer depends on the efficiency of his own work,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: but on that of his men. The foremen are appointed from among the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: assistant foremen, by the same exercise of discretion limited to a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: small eligible class. In the appointments to the still higher grades
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: another principle is introduced, which it would take too much time to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: explain now.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course such a system of grading as I have described would have been
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: impracticable applied to the small industrial concerns of your day, in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: some of which there were hardly enough employees to have left one
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: apiece for the classes. You must remember that, under the national
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: organization of labor, all industries are carried on by great bodies of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: men, many of your farms or shops being combined as one. It is also
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: owing solely to the vast scale on which each industry is organized,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with co-ordinate establishments in every part of the country, that we
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are able by exchanges and transfers to fit every man so nearly with the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sort of work he can do best.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "And now, Mr. West, I will leave it to you, on the bare outline of its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: features which I have given, if those who need special incentives to do
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their best are likely to lack them under our system. Does it not seem
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to you that men who found themselves obliged, whether they wished or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not, to work, would under such a system be strongly impelled to do
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their best?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I replied that it seemed to me the incentives offered were, if any
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: objection were to be made, too strong; that the pace set for the young
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: men was too hot; and such, indeed, I would add with deference, still
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remains my opinion, now that by longer residence among you I become
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: better acquainted with the whole subject.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Dr. Leete, however, desired me to reflect, and I am ready to say that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: it is perhaps a sufficient reply to my objection, that the worker's
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: livelihood is in no way dependent on his ranking, and anxiety for that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: never embitters his disappointments; that the working hours are short,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the vacations regular, and that all emulation ceases at forty-five,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with the attainment of middle life.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There are two or three other points I ought to refer to," he added,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "to prevent your getting mistaken impressions. In the first place, you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must understand that this system of preferment given the more efficient
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workers over the less so, in no way contravenes the fundamental idea of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our social system, that all who do their best are equally deserving,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: whether that best be great or small. I have shown that the system is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: arranged to encourage the weaker as well as the stronger with the hope
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of rising, while the fact that the stronger are selected for the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: leaders is in no way a reflection upon the weaker, but in the interest
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the common weal.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Do not imagine, either, because emulation is given free play as an
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: incentive under our system, that we deem it a motive likely to appeal
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the nobler sort of men, or worthy of them. Such as these find their
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: motives within, not without, and measure their duty by their own
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: endowments, not by those of others. So long as their achievement is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proportioned to their powers, they would consider it preposterous to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: expect praise or blame because it chanced to be great or small. To such
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: natures emulation appears philosophically absurd, and despicable in a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: moral aspect by its substitution of envy for admiration, and exultation
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for regret, in one's attitude toward the successes and the failures of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: others.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But all men, even in the last year of the twentieth century, are not
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of this high order, and the incentives to endeavor requisite for those
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who are not must be of a sort adapted to their inferior natures. For
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: these, then, emulation of the keenest edge is provided as a constant
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: spur. Those who need this motive will feel it. Those who are above its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: influence do not need it.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I should not fail to mention," resumed the doctor, "that for those too
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: deficient in mental or bodily strength to be fairly graded with the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: main body of workers, we have a separate grade, unconnected with the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: others,--a sort of invalid corps, the members of which are provided
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: with a light class of tasks fitted to their strength. All our sick in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: mind and body, all our deaf and dumb, and lame and blind and crippled,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and even our insane, belong to this invalid corps, and bear its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: insignia. The strongest often do nearly a man's work, the feeblest, of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: course, nothing; but none who can do anything are willing quite to give
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: up. In their lucid intervals, even our insane are eager to do what they
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: can."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That is a pretty idea of the invalid corps," I said. "Even a barbarian
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from the nineteenth century can appreciate that. It is a very graceful
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: way of disguising charity, and must be grateful to the feelings of its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recipients."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Charity!" repeated Dr. Leete. "Did you suppose that we consider the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: incapable class we are talking of objects of charity?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Why, naturally," I said, "inasmuch as they are incapable of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: self-support."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: But here the doctor took me up quickly.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Who is capable of self-support?" he demanded. "There is no such thing
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in a civilized society as self-support. In a state of society so
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: barbarous as not even to know family cooperation, each individual may
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possibly support himself, though even then for a part of his life only;
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: but from the moment that men begin to live together, and constitute
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: even the rudest sort of society, self-support becomes impossible. As
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: men grow more civilized, and the subdivision of occupations and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: services is carried out, a complex mutual dependence becomes the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: universal rule. Every man, however solitary may seem his occupation, is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a member of a vast industrial partnership, as large as the nation, as
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: large as humanity. The necessity of mutual dependence should imply the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: duty and guarantee of mutual support; and that it did not in your day
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: constituted the essential cruelty and unreason of your system."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That may all be so," I replied, "but it does not touch the case of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: those who are unable to contribute anything to the product of industry."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Surely I told you this morning, at least I thought I did," replied Dr.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Leete, "that the right of a man to maintenance at the nation's table
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: depends on the fact that he is a man, and not on the amount of health
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and strength he may have, so long as he does his best."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You said so," I answered, "but I supposed the rule applied only to the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workers of different ability. Does it also hold of those who can do
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nothing at all?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Are they not also men?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I am to understand, then, that the lame, the blind, the sick, and the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: impotent, are as well off as the most efficient and have the same
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: income?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly," was the reply.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The idea of charity on such a scale," I answered, "would have made our
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: most enthusiastic philanthropists gasp."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If you had a sick brother at home," replied Dr. Leete, "unable to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: work, would you feed him on less dainty food, and lodge and clothe him
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more poorly, than yourself? More likely far, you would give him the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: preference; nor would you think of calling it charity. Would not the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: word, in that connection, fill you with indignation?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course," I replied; "but the cases are not parallel. There is a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sense, no doubt, in which all men are brothers; but this general sort
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of brotherhood is not to be compared, except for rhetorical purposes,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the brotherhood of blood, either as to its sentiment or its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: obligations."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "There speaks the nineteenth century!" exclaimed Dr. Leete. "Ah, Mr.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: West, there is no doubt as to the length of time that you slept. If I
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: were to give you, in one sentence, a key to what may seem the mysteries
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of our civilization as compared with that of your age, I should say
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that it is the fact that the solidarity of the race and the brotherhood
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of man, which to you were but fine phrases, are, to our thinking and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: feeling, ties as real and as vital as physical fraternity.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But even setting that consideration aside, I do not see why it so
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: surprises you that those who cannot work are conceded the full right to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: live on the produce of those who can. Even in your day, the duty of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: military service for the protection of the nation, to which our
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial service corresponds, while obligatory on those able to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: discharge it, did not operate to deprive of the privileges of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: citizenship those who were unable. They stayed at home, and were
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: protected by those who fought, and nobody questioned their right to be,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or thought less of them. So, now, the requirement of industrial service
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from those able to render it does not operate to deprive of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: privileges of citizenship, which now implies the citizen's maintenance,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: him who cannot work. The worker is not a citizen because he works, but
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: works because he is a citizen. As you recognize the duty of the strong
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to fight for the weak, we, now that fighting is gone by, recognize his
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
