author: Bellamy, Edward

text: warehouse and observe actually in operation the machinery of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distribution, which Edith had described to me. As we walked away from
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the house I said, "It is now several days that I have been living in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: your household on a most extraordinary footing, or rather on none at
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all. I have not spoken of this aspect of my position before because
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there were so many other aspects yet more extraordinary. But now that I
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: am beginning a little to feel my feet under me, and to realize that,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: however I came here, I am here, and must make the best of it, I must
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: speak to you on this point."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "As for your being a guest in my house," replied Dr. Leete, "I pray you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not to begin to be uneasy on that point, for I mean to keep you a long
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: time yet. With all your modesty, you can but realize that such a guest
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as yourself is an acquisition not willingly to be parted with."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Thanks, doctor," I said. "It would be absurd, certainly, for me to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: affect any oversensitiveness about accepting the temporary hospitality
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of one to whom I owe it that I am not still awaiting the end of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: world in a living tomb. But if I am to be a permanent citizen of this
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: century I must have some standing in it. Now, in my time a person more
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: or less entering the world, however he got in, would not be noticed in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the unorganized throng of men, and might make a place for himself
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: anywhere he chose if he were strong enough. But nowadays everybody is a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: part of a system with a distinct place and function. I am outside the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system, and don't see how I can get in; there seems no way to get in,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: except to be born in or to come in as an emigrant from some other
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: system."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Dr. Leete laughed heartily.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I admit," he said, "that our system is defective in lacking provision
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for cases like yours, but you see nobody anticipated additions to the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: world except by the usual process. You need, however, have no fear that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: we shall be unable to provide both a place and occupation for you in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: due time. You have as yet been brought in contact only with the members
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of my family, but you must not suppose that I have kept your secret. On
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the contrary, your case, even before your resuscitation, and vastly
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more since has excited the profoundest interest in the nation. In view
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of your precarious nervous condition, it was thought best that I should
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: take exclusive charge of you at first, and that you should, through me
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and my family, receive some general idea of the sort of world you had
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: come back to before you began to make the acquaintance generally of its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inhabitants. As to finding a function for you in society, there was no
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hesitation as to what that would be. Few of us have it in our power to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: confer so great a service on the nation as you will be able to when you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: leave my roof, which, however, you must not think of doing for a good
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: time yet."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "What can I possibly do?" I asked. "Perhaps you imagine I have some
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trade, or art, or special skill. I assure you I have none whatever. I
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: never earned a dollar in my life, or did an hour's work. I am strong,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and might be a common laborer, but nothing more."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If that were the most efficient service you were able to render the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation, you would find that avocation considered quite as respectable
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as any other," replied Dr. Leete; "but you can do something else
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: better. You are easily the master of all our historians on questions
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: relating to the social condition of the latter part of the nineteenth
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: century, to us one of the most absorbingly interesting periods of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: history: and whenever in due time you have sufficiently familiarized
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: yourself with our institutions, and are willing to teach us something
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: concerning those of your day, you will find an historical lectureship
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in one of our colleges awaiting you."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Very good! very good indeed," I said, much relieved by so practical a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: suggestion on a point which had begun to trouble me. "If your people
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are really so much interested in the nineteenth century, there will
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: indeed be an occupation ready-made for me. I don't think there is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: anything else that I could possibly earn my salt at, but I certainly
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: may claim without conceit to have some special qualifications for such
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a post as you describe."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Chapter 17
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I found the processes at the warehouse quite as interesting as Edith
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had described them, and became even enthusiastic over the truly
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: remarkable illustration which is seen there of the prodigiously
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: multiplied efficiency which perfect organization can give to labor. It
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is like a gigantic mill, into the hopper of which goods are being
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: constantly poured by the train-load and shipload, to issue at the other
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: end in packages of pounds and ounces, yards and inches, pints and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: gallons, corresponding to the infinitely complex personal needs of half
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a million people. Dr. Leete, with the assistance of data furnished by
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: me as to the way goods were sold in my day, figured out some astounding
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: results in the way of the economies effected by the modern system.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: As we set out homeward, I said: "After what I have seen to-day,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: together with what you have told me, and what I learned under Miss
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Leete's tutelage at the sample store, I have a tolerably clear idea of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: your system of distribution, and how it enables you to dispense with a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: circulating medium. But I should like very much to know something more
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: about your system of production. You have told me in general how your
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial army is levied and organized, but who directs its efforts?
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: What supreme authority determines what shall be done in every
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: department, so that enough of everything is produced and yet no labor
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wasted? It seems to me that this must be a wonderfully complex and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: difficult function, requiring very unusual endowments."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Does it indeed seem so to you?" responded Dr. Leete. "I assure you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that it is nothing of the kind, but on the other hand so simple, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: depending on principles so obvious and easily applied, that the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: functionaries at Washington to whom it is trusted require to be nothing
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more than men of fair abilities to discharge it to the entire
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: satisfaction of the nation. The machine which they direct is indeed a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: vast one, but so logical in its principles and direct and simple in its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: workings, that it all but runs itself; and nobody but a fool could
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: derange it, as I think you will agree after a few words of explanation.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Since you already have a pretty good idea of the working of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distributive system, let us begin at that end. Even in your day
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: statisticians were able to tell you the number of yards of cotton,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: velvet, woolen, the number of barrels of flour, potatoes, butter,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: number of pairs of shoes, hats, and umbrellas annually consumed by the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation. Owing to the fact that production was in private hands, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that there was no way of getting statistics of actual distribution,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: these figures were not exact, but they were nearly so. Now that every
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: pin which is given out from a national warehouse is recorded, of course
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the figures of consumption for any week, month, or year, in the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possession of the department of distribution at the end of that period,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are precise. On these figures, allowing for tendencies to increase or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: decrease and for any special causes likely to affect demand, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: estimates, say for a year ahead, are based. These estimates, with a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proper margin for security, having been accepted by the general
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: administration, the responsibility of the distributive department
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ceases until the goods are delivered to it. I speak of the estimates
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: being furnished for an entire year ahead, but in reality they cover
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that much time only in case of the great staples for which the demand
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: can be calculated on as steady. In the great majority of smaller
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industries for the product of which popular taste fluctuates, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: novelty is frequently required, production is kept barely ahead of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: consumption, the distributive department furnishing frequent estimates
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: based on the weekly state of demand.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Now the entire field of productive and constructive industry is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: divided into ten great departments, each representing a group of allied
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industries, each particular industry being in turn represented by a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: subordinate bureau, which has a complete record of the plant and force
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: under its control, of the present product, and means of increasing it.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The estimates of the distributive department, after adoption by the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: administration, are sent as mandates to the ten great departments,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which allot them to the subordinate bureaus representing the particular
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industries, and these set the men at work. Each bureau is responsible
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: for the task given it, and this responsibility is enforced by
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: departmental oversight and that of the administration; nor does the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: distributive department accept the product without its own inspection;
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: while even if in the hands of the consumer an article turns out unfit,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the system enables the fault to be traced back to the original workman.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The production of the commodities for actual public consumption does
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not, of course, require by any means all the national force of workers.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: After the necessary contingents have been detailed for the various
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industries, the amount of labor left for other employment is expended
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in creating fixed capital, such as buildings, machinery, engineering
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: works, and so forth."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "One point occurs to me," I said, "on which I should think there might
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: be dissatisfaction. Where there is no opportunity for private
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enterprise, how is there any assurance that the claims of small
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: minorities of the people to have articles produced, for which there is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: no wide demand, will be respected? An official decree at any moment may
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: deprive them of the means of gratifying some special taste, merely
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: because the majority does not share it."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That would be tyranny indeed," replied Dr. Leete, "and you may be very
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sure that it does not happen with us, to whom liberty is as dear as
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: equality or fraternity. As you come to know our system better, you will
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: see that our officials are in fact, and not merely in name, the agents
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and servants of the people. The administration has no power to stop the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production of any commodity for which there continues to be a demand.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Suppose the demand for any article declines to such a point that its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production becomes very costly. The price has to be raised in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: proportion, of course, but as long as the consumer cares to pay it, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: production goes on. Again, suppose an article not before produced is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: demanded. If the administration doubts the reality of the demand, a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: popular petition guaranteeing a certain basis of consumption compels it
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to produce the desired article. A government, or a majority, which
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: should undertake to tell the people, or a minority, what they were to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: eat, drink, or wear, as I believe governments in America did in your
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: day, would be regarded as a curious anachronism indeed. Possibly you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: had reasons for tolerating these infringements of personal
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: independence, but we should not think them endurable. I am glad you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: raised this point, for it has given me a chance to show you how much
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more direct and efficient is the control over production exercised by
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the individual citizen now than it was in your day, when what you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: called private initiative prevailed, though it should have been called
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: capitalist initiative, for the average private citizen had little
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enough share in it."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You speak of raising the price of costly articles," I said. "How can
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: prices be regulated in a country where there is no competition between
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: buyers or sellers?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Just as they were with you," replied Dr. Leete. "You think that needs
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: explaining," he added, as I looked incredulous, "but the explanation
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: need not be long; the cost of the labor which produced it was
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recognized as the legitimate basis of the price of an article in your
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: day, and so it is in ours. In your day, it was the difference in wages
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that made the difference in the cost of labor; now it is the relative
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: number of hours constituting a day's work in different trades, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: maintenance of the worker being equal in all cases. The cost of a man's
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: work in a trade so difficult that in order to attract volunteers the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hours have to be fixed at four a day is twice as great as that in a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trade where the men work eight hours. The result as to the cost of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor, you see, is just the same as if the man working four hours were
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: paid, under your system, twice the wages the others get. This
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: calculation applied to the labor employed in the various processes of a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: manufactured article gives its price relatively to other articles.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Besides the cost of production and transportation, the factor of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: scarcity affects the prices of some commodities. As regards the great
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: staples of life, of which an abundance can always be secured, scarcity
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is eliminated as a factor. There is always a large surplus kept on hand
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from which any fluctuations of demand or supply can be corrected, even
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in most cases of bad crops. The prices of the staples grow less year by
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: year, but rarely, if ever, rise. There are, however, certain classes of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: articles permanently, and others temporarily, unequal to the demand,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as, for example, fresh fish or dairy products in the latter category,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and the products of high skill and rare materials in the other. All
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: that can be done here is to equalize the inconvenience of the scarcity.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: This is done by temporarily raising the price if the scarcity be
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: temporary, or fixing it high if it be permanent. High prices in your
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: day meant restriction of the articles affected to the rich, but
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nowadays, when the means of all are the same, the effect is only that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: those to whom the articles seem most desirable are the ones who
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: purchase them. Of course the nation, as any other caterer for the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: public needs must be, is frequently left with small lots of goods on
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: its hands by changes in taste, unseasonable weather and various other
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: causes. These it has to dispose of at a sacrifice just as merchants
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: often did in your day, charging up the loss to the expenses of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business. Owing, however, to the vast body of consumers to which such
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lots can be simultaneously offered, there is rarely any difficulty in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: getting rid of them at trifling loss. I have given you now some general
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: notion of our system of production; as well as distribution. Do you
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: find it as complex as you expected?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: I admitted that nothing could be much simpler.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I am sure," said Dr. Leete, "that it is within the truth to say that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the head of one of the myriad private businesses of your day, who had
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to maintain sleepless vigilance against the fluctuations of the market,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the machinations of his rivals, and the failure of his debtors, had a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: far more trying task than the group of men at Washington who nowadays
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: direct the industries of the entire nation. All this merely shows, my
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dear fellow, how much easier it is to do things the right way than the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wrong. It is easier for a general up in a balloon, with perfect survey
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the field, to manoeuvre a million men to victory than for a sergeant
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to manage a platoon in a thicket."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The general of this army, including the flower of the manhood of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation, must be the foremost man in the country, really greater even
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than the President of the United States," I said.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "He is the President of the United States," replied Dr. Leete, "or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rather the most important function of the presidency is the headship of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the industrial army."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How is he chosen?" I asked.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I explained to you before," replied Dr. Leete, "when I was describing
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the force of the motive of emulation among all grades of the industrial
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: army, that the line of promotion for the meritorious lies through three
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: grades to the officer's grade, and thence up through the lieutenancies
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the captaincy or foremanship, and superintendency or colonel's rank.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Next, with an intervening grade in some of the larger trades, comes the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: general of the guild, under whose immediate control all the operations
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the trade are conducted. This officer is at the head of the national
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bureau representing his trade, and is responsible for its work to the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: administration. The general of his guild holds a splendid position, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: one which amply satisfies the ambition of most men, but above his rank,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which may be compared--to follow the military analogies familiar to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: you--to that of a general of division or major-general, is that of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: chiefs of the ten great departments, or groups of allied trades. The
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: chiefs of these ten grand divisions of the industrial army may be
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: compared to your commanders of army corps, or lieutenant-generals, each
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: having from a dozen to a score of generals of separate guilds reporting
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to him. Above these ten great officers, who form his council, is the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: general-in-chief, who is the President of the United States.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The general-in-chief of the industrial army must have passed through
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all the grades below him, from the common laborers up. Let us see how
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: he rises. As I have told you, it is simply by the excellence of his
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: record as a worker that one rises through the grades of the privates
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and becomes a candidate for a lieutenancy. Through the lieutenancies he
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rises to the colonelcy, or superintendent's position, by appointment
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from above, strictly limited to the candidates of the best records. The
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: general of the guild appoints to the ranks under him, but he himself is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not appointed, but chosen by suffrage."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "By suffrage!" I exclaimed. "Is not that ruinous to the discipline of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the guild, by tempting the candidates to intrigue for the support of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the workers under them?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "So it would be, no doubt," replied Dr. Leete, "if the workers had any
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: suffrage to exercise, or anything to say about the choice. But they
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have nothing. Just here comes in a peculiarity of our system. The
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: general of the guild is chosen from among the superintendents by vote
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the honorary members of the guild, that is, of those who have served
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: their time in the guild and received their discharge. As you know, at
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the age of forty-five we are mustered out of the army of industry, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have the residue of life for the pursuit of our own improvement or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recreation. Of course, however, the associations of our active lifetime
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: retain a powerful hold on us. The companionships we formed then remain
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our companionships till the end of life. We always continue honorary
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: members of our former guilds, and retain the keenest and most jealous
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interest in their welfare and repute in the hands of the following
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: generation. In the clubs maintained by the honorary members of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: several guilds, in which we meet socially, there are no topics of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: conversation so common as those which relate to these matters, and the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: young aspirants for guild leadership who can pass the criticism of us
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: old fellows are likely to be pretty well equipped. Recognizing this
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fact, the nation entrusts to the honorary members of each guild the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: election of its general, and I venture to claim that no previous form
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of society could have developed a body of electors so ideally adapted
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to their office, as regards absolute impartiality, knowledge of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: special qualifications and record of candidates, solicitude for the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: best result, and complete absence of self-interest.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Each of the ten lieutenant-generals or heads of departments is himself
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: elected from among the generals of the guilds grouped as a department,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by vote of the honorary members of the guilds thus grouped. Of course
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there is a tendency on the part of each guild to vote for its own
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: general, but no guild of any group has nearly enough votes to elect a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: man not supported by most of the others. I assure you that these
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: elections are exceedingly lively."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The President, I suppose, is selected from among the ten heads of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: great departments," I suggested.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Precisely, but the heads of departments are not eligible to the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: presidency till they have been a certain number of years out of office.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: It is rarely that a man passes through all the grades to the headship
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of a department much before he is forty, and at the end of a five
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: years' term he is usually forty-five. If more, he still serves through
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: his term, and if less, he is nevertheless discharged from the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: industrial army at its termination. It would not do for him to return
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the ranks. The interval before he is a candidate for the presidency
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: is intended to give time for him to recognize fully that he has
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: returned into the general mass of the nation, and is identified with it
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rather than with the industrial army. Moreover, it is expected that he
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: will employ this period in studying the general condition of the army,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: instead of that of the special group of guilds of which he was the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: head. From among the former heads of departments who may be eligible at
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the time, the President is elected by vote of all the men of the nation
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: who are not connected with the industrial army."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "The army is not allowed to vote for President?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly not. That would be perilous to its discipline, which it is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the business of the President to maintain as the representative of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nation at large. His right hand for this purpose is the inspectorate, a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: highly important department of our system; to the inspectorate come all
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: complaints or information as to defects in goods, insolence or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: inefficiency of officials, or dereliction of any sort in the public
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: service. The inspectorate, however, does not wait for complaints. Not
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only is it on the alert to catch and sift every rumor of a fault in the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: service, but it is its business, by systematic and constant oversight
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and inspection of every branch of the army, to find out what is going
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: wrong before anybody else does. The President is usually not far from
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fifty when elected, and serves five years, forming an honorable
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: exception to the rule of retirement at forty-five. At the end of his
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: term of office, a national Congress is called to receive his report and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: approve or condemn it. If it is approved, Congress usually elects him
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to represent the nation for five years more in the international
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: council. Congress, I should also say, passes on the reports of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: outgoing heads of departments, and a disapproval renders any one of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them ineligible for President. But it is rare, indeed, that the nation
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: has occasion for other sentiments than those of gratitude toward its
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: high officers. As to their ability, to have risen from the ranks, by
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tests so various and severe, to their positions, is proof in itself of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: extraordinary qualities, while as to faithfulness, our social system
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: leaves them absolutely without any other motive than that of winning
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the esteem of their fellow citizens. Corruption is impossible in a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: society where there is neither poverty to be bribed nor wealth to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bribe, while as to demagoguery or intrigue for office, the conditions
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of promotion render them out of the question."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "One point I do not quite understand," I said. "Are the members of the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: liberal professions eligible to the presidency? and if so, how are they
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ranked with those who pursue the industries proper?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They have no ranking with them," replied Dr. Leete. "The members of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the technical professions, such as engineers and architects, have a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ranking with the constructive guilds; but the members of the liberal
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: professions, the doctors and teachers, as well as the artists and men
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of letters who obtain remissions of industrial service, do not belong
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to the industrial army. On this ground they vote for the President, but
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are not eligible to his office. One of its main duties being the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: control and discipline of the industrial army, it is essential that the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: President should have passed through all its grades to understand his
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That is reasonable," I said; "but if the doctors and teachers do not
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: know enough of industry to be President, neither, I should think, can
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the President know enough of medicine and education to control those
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: departments."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "No more does he," was the reply. "Except in the general way that he is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: responsible for the enforcement of the laws as to all classes, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: President has nothing to do with the faculties of medicine and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: education, which are controlled by boards of regents of their own, in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which the President is ex-officio chairman, and has the casting vote.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: These regents, who, of course, are responsible to Congress, are chosen
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: by the honorary members of the guilds of education and medicine, the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: retired teachers and doctors of the country."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Do you know," I said, "the method of electing officials by votes of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the retired members of the guilds is nothing more than the application
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: on a national scale of the plan of government by alumni, which we used
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to a slight extent occasionally in the management of our higher
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: educational institutions."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Did you, indeed?" exclaimed Dr. Leete, with animation. "That is quite
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: new to me, and I fancy will be to most of us, and of much interest as
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: well. There has been great discussion as to the germ of the idea, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: we fancied that there was for once something new under the sun. Well!
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: well! In your higher educational institutions! that is interesting
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: indeed. You must tell me more of that."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Truly, there is very little more to tell than I have told already," I
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: replied. "If we had the germ of your idea, it was but as a germ."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Chapter 18
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: That evening I sat up for some time after the ladies had retired,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: talking with Dr. Leete about the effect of the plan of exempting men
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from further service to the nation after the age of forty-five, a point
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: brought up by his account of the part taken by the retired citizens in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the government.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "At forty-five," said I, "a man still has ten years of good manual
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: labor in him, and twice ten years of good intellectual service. To be
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: superannuated at that age and laid on the shelf must be regarded rather
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as a hardship than a favor by men of energetic dispositions."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "My dear Mr. West," exclaimed Dr. Leete, beaming upon me, "you cannot
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: have any idea of the piquancy your nineteenth century ideas have for us
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of this day, the rare quaintness of their effect. Know, O child of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: another race and yet the same, that the labor we have to render as our
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: part in securing for the nation the means of a comfortable physical
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: existence is by no means regarded as the most important, the most
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: interesting, or the most dignified employment of our powers. We look
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: upon it as a necessary duty to be discharged before we can fully devote
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: ourselves to the higher exercise of our faculties, the intellectual and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: spiritual enjoyments and pursuits which alone mean life. Everything
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: possible is indeed done by the just distribution of burdens, and by all
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: manner of special attractions and incentives to relieve our labor of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: irksomeness, and, except in a comparative sense, it is not usually
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: irksome, and is often inspiring. But it is not our labor, but the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: higher and larger activities which the performance of our task will
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: leave us free to enter upon, that are considered the main business of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: existence.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of course not all, nor the majority, have those scientific, artistic,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: literary, or scholarly interests which make leisure the one thing
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: valuable to their possessors. Many look upon the last half of life
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: chiefly as a period for enjoyment of other sorts; for travel, for
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: social relaxation in the company of their life-time friends; a time for
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the cultivation of all manner of personal idiosyncrasies and special
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tastes, and the pursuit of every imaginable form of recreation; in a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: word, a time for the leisurely and unperturbed appreciation of the good
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: things of the world which they have helped to create. But, whatever the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: differences between our individual tastes as to the use we shall put
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: our leisure to, we all agree in looking forward to the date of our
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: discharge as the time when we shall first enter upon the full enjoyment
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of our birthright, the period when we shall first really attain our
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: majority and become enfranchised from discipline and control, with the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: fee of our lives vested in ourselves. As eager boys in your day
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: anticipated twenty-one, so men nowadays look forward to forty-five. At
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: twenty-one we become men, but at forty-five we renew youth. Middle age
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and what you would have called old age are considered, rather than
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: youth, the enviable time of life. Thanks to the better conditions of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: existence nowadays, and above all the freedom of every one from care,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: old age approaches many years later and has an aspect far more benign
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: than in past times. Persons of average constitution usually live to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: eighty-five or ninety, and at forty-five we are physically and mentally
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: younger, I fancy, than you were at thirty-five. It is a strange
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reflection that at forty-five, when we are just entering upon the most
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: enjoyable period of life, you already began to think of growing old and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to look backward. With you it was the forenoon, with us it is the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: afternoon, which is the brighter half of life."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: After this I remember that our talk branched into the subject of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: popular sports and recreations at the present time as compared with
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: those of the nineteenth century.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In one respect," said Dr. Leete, "there is a marked difference. The
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: professional sportsmen, which were such a curious feature of your day,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: we have nothing answering to, nor are the prizes for which our athletes
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: contend money prizes, as with you. Our contests are always for glory
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: only. The generous rivalry existing between the various guilds, and the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: loyalty of each worker to his own, afford a constant stimulation to all

title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: In the course of an early morning constitutional I visited Charlestown.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Among the changes, too numerous to attempt to indicate, which mark the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lapse of a century in that quarter, I particularly noted the total
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: disappearance of the old state prison.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That went before my day, but I remember hearing about it," said Dr.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Leete, when I alluded to the fact at the breakfast table. "We have no
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: jails nowadays. All cases of atavism are treated in the hospitals."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Of atavism!" I exclaimed, staring.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Why, yes," replied Dr. Leete. "The idea of dealing punitively with
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: those unfortunates was given up at least fifty years ago, and I think
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: more."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I don't quite understand you," I said. "Atavism in my day was a word
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: applied to the cases of persons in whom some trait of a remote ancestor
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: recurred in a noticeable manner. Am I to understand that crime is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nowadays looked upon as the recurrence of an ancestral trait?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I beg your pardon," said Dr. Leete with a smile half humorous, half
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: deprecating, "but since you have so explicitly asked the question, I am
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forced to say that the fact is precisely that."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: After what I had already learned of the moral contrasts between the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteenth and the twentieth centuries, it was doubtless absurd in me
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to begin to develop sensitiveness on the subject, and probably if Dr.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: Leete had not spoken with that apologetic air and Mrs. Leete and Edith
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: shown a corresponding embarrassment, I should not have flushed, as I
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was conscious I did.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "I was not in much danger of being vain of my generation before," I
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: said; "but, really--"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "This is your generation, Mr. West," interposed Edith. "It is the one
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in which you are living, you know, and it is only because we are alive
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: now that we call it ours."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Thank you. I will try to think of it so," I said, and as my eyes met
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: hers their expression quite cured my senseless sensitiveness. "After
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: all," I said, with a laugh, "I was brought up a Calvinist, and ought
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: not to be startled to hear crime spoken of as an ancestral trait."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "In point of fact," said Dr. Leete, "our use of the word is no
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reflection at all on your generation, if, begging Edith's pardon, we
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: may call it yours, so far as seeming to imply that we think ourselves,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: apart from our circumstances, better than you were. In your day fully
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: nineteen twentieths of the crime, using the word broadly to include all
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sorts of misdemeanors, resulted from the inequality in the possessions
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of individuals; want tempted the poor, lust of greater gains, or the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: desire to preserve former gains, tempted the well-to-do. Directly or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: indirectly, the desire for money, which then meant every good thing,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: was the motive of all this crime, the taproot of a vast poison growth,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which the machinery of law, courts, and police could barely prevent
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from choking your civilization outright. When we made the nation the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: sole trustee of the wealth of the people, and guaranteed to all
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: abundant maintenance, on the one hand abolishing want, and on the other
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: checking the accumulation of riches, we cut this root, and the poison
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: tree that overshadowed your society withered, like Jonah's gourd, in a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: day. As for the comparatively small class of violent crimes against
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: persons, unconnected with any idea of gain, they were almost wholly
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: confined, even in your day, to the ignorant and bestial; and in these
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: days, when education and good manners are not the monopoly of a few,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: but universal, such atrocities are scarcely ever heard of. You now see
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: why the word 'atavism' is used for crime. It is because nearly all
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: forms of crime known to you are motiveless now, and when they appear
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: can only be explained as the outcropping of ancestral traits. You used
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: to call persons who stole, evidently without any rational motive,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: kleptomaniacs, and when the case was clear deemed it absurd to punish
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: them as thieves. Your attitude toward the genuine kleptomaniac is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: precisely ours toward the victim of atavism, an attitude of compassion
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and firm but gentle restraint."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Your courts must have an easy time of it," I observed. "With no
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: private property to speak of, no disputes between citizens over
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: business relations, no real estate to divide or debts to collect, there
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: must be absolutely no civil business at all for them; and with no
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: offenses against property, and mighty few of any sort to provide
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: criminal cases, I should think you might almost do without judges and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: lawyers altogether."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "We do without the lawyers, certainly," was Dr. Leete's reply. "It
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: would not seem reasonable to us, in a case where the only interest of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the nation is to find out the truth, that persons should take part in
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the proceedings who had an acknowledged motive to color it."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "But who defends the accused?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If he is a criminal he needs no defense, for he pleads guilty in most
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: instances," replied Dr. Leete. "The plea of the accused is not a mere
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: formality with us, as with you. It is usually the end of the case."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You don't mean that the man who pleads not guilty is thereupon
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: discharged?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "No, I do not mean that. He is not accused on light grounds, and if he
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: denies his guilt, must still be tried. But trials are few, for in most
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: cases the guilty man pleads guilty. When he makes a false plea and is
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: clearly proved guilty, his penalty is doubled. Falsehood is, however,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so despised among us that few offenders would lie to save themselves."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "That is the most astounding thing you have yet told me," I exclaimed.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "If lying has gone out of fashion, this is indeed the 'new heavens and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the new earth wherein dwelleth righteousness,' which the prophet
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: foretold."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Such is, in fact, the belief of some persons nowadays," was the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: doctor's answer. "They hold that we have entered upon the millennium,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: and the theory from their point of view does not lack plausibility. But
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: as to your astonishment at finding that the world has outgrown lying,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: there is really no ground for it. Falsehood, even in your day, was not
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: common between gentlemen and ladies, social equals. The lie of fear was
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the refuge of cowardice, and the lie of fraud the device of the cheat.
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: The inequalities of men and the lust of acquisition offered a constant
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: premium on lying at that time. Yet even then, the man who neither
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: feared another nor desired to defraud him scorned falsehood. Because we
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: are now all social equals, and no man either has anything to fear from
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: another or can gain anything by deceiving him, the contempt of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: falsehood is so universal that it is rarely, as I told you, that even a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: criminal in other respects will be found willing to lie. When, however,
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a plea of not guilty is returned, the judge appoints two colleagues to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: state the opposite sides of the case. How far these men are from being
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: like your hired advocates and prosecutors, determined to acquit or
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: convict, may appear from the fact that unless both agree that the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: verdict found is just, the case is tried over, while anything like bias
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in the tone of either of the judges stating the case would be a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: shocking scandal."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Do I understand," I said, "that it is a judge who states each side of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: the case as well as a judge who hears it?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "Certainly. The judges take turns in serving on the bench and at the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: bar, and are expected to maintain the judicial temper equally whether
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: in stating or deciding a case. The system is indeed in effect that of
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: trial by three judges occupying different points of view as to the
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: case. When they agree upon a verdict, we believe it to be as near to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: absolute truth as men well can come."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "You have given up the jury system, then?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "It was well enough as a corrective in the days of hired advocates, and
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: a bench sometimes venal, and often with a tenure that made it
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: dependent, but is needless now. No conceivable motive but justice could
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: actuate our judges."
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "How are these magistrates selected?"
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: "They are an honorable exception to the rule which discharges all men
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: from service at the age of forty-five. The President of the nation
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: appoints the necessary judges year by year from the class reaching that
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: age. The number appointed is, of course, exceedingly few, and the honor
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: so high that it is held an offset to the additional term of service
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: which follows, and though a judge's appointment may be declined, it
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: rarely is. The term is five years, without eligibility to
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: reappointment. The members of the Supreme Court, which is the guardian
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward

text: of the constitution, are selected from among the lower judges. When a
title: Looking Backward, 2000 to 1887
author: Bellamy, Edward
